comments:
Trying to run a plugin in the runtime workbench. I selected the plugin and then clicked "add all required plugins". When I then start the plugin the Navigator-View shows the error message:

Unable to create view: Plug-in "org.eclipse.ui.ide" was unable to instantiate class "org.eclipse.ui.views.navigator.ResourceNavigator".


Clicking on "Details" reveals:

Which plug-in were you trying to test (ie. which plug-in did you select before hitting add all required plugins)?

Marking as duplicate since other bug has better description.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 165665 ***

I had been trying to run a diagram editor plugin that I had developed using GMF.
These diagram editors require to be able to create and select projects, since the diagram files it creates are resources that are part of a project. Hence the Navigator View is a required prerequisite to be able to use it.

But maybe I should rather suggest to the GMF folks to make sure that this plugin is somewhere referenced in the code they generate...

Michael
